page.title: 08DIALYSING AT LITTLE MILL
page.content: I moved to Little Mill in 1976 and obtained a kidney dialysis machine for home use,my kidneys having failed in 1974.Dialysis is a method of cleansing the blood of electrolytes and removing excess water from the bloodstream.This operation is done by inserting two large needles into one's veins,one vessel arterial and the other venous. Blood then flows through connecting tubing to an artificial kidney,helped by a pump and returned to the body.The process takes six hours repeated three times per week. The kidney machine relys on a good pressured supply of water,filtered and softened.It uses 19 gallons each session.Electricity is also required and should a cut in supply occur I have to disconnect myself quickly and return what blood I can to my body by gravity feed.
